sections.content: The purpose of this intervention is to offer you basic information on fixed prosthodontic treatment. Your dentist will be able to identify the specific benefits, risks, and/or alternative treatment options that apply to you.
sections.audioText: The purpose of this intervention is to offer you basic information on fixed prosthodontic treatment. Your dentist will be able to identify the specific benefits, risks, and/or alternative treatment options that apply to you.

sections.section: What is a fixed prosthodontic treatment?
sections.content: It is a type of dental treatment in which artificial teeth are used to replace a part of a tooth or a missing tooth or teeth and are fixed to the existing tooth or teeth. The artificial tooth may be supported by a natural tooth or teeth or implant(s)- a nail-like metal inserted in the jaw bone. They include implants, crowns, bridges, and veneers.
sections.audioText: It is a type of dental treatment in which artificial teeth are used to replace a part of a tooth or a missing tooth or teeth and are fixed to the existing tooth or teeth. The artificial tooth may be supported by a natural tooth or teeth or implant(s)- a nail-like metal inserted in the jaw bone. They include implants, crowns, bridges, and veneers.

sections.content: It is a type of restoration that covers a damaged or deformed tooth and restores it to its natural size, shape, color, and function.
sections.audioText: It is a type of restoration that covers a damaged or deformed tooth and restores it to its natural size, shape, color, and function.

sections.section: Reasons for the treatment with a crown
sections.content: There are many indications for a crown including: • To strengthen a tooth, for example a root canal-treated tooth, a cracked tooth, or a tooth with large fillings; • To improve appearance (e.g. colour or shape); and • To improve function.
sections.audioText: There are many indications for a crown including: to strengthen a tooth, for example a root canal-treated tooth, a cracked tooth, or a tooth with large fillings; to improve appearance, such as improving the colour or shape; and to improve function.

sections.content: It is a type of restoration that replaces missing tooth or teeth and it is fixed on occurring natural tooth or teeth or an implant (nail-like metals inserted in the jaw bone).
sections.audioText: It is a type of restoration that replaces missing tooth or teeth and it is fixed on occurring natural tooth or teeth or an implant (nail-like metals inserted in the jaw bone).

sections.section: Reasons for the treatment with a bridge
sections.content: There are many indications for a bridgework, including: • To replace a missing tooth/teeth; • To improve appearance (e.g. colour or shape); and • To improve function.
sections.audioText: There are many indications for a bridgework, including: to replace a missing tooth or teeth, to improve appearance such as colour or shape, and to improve function.

sections.content: It is a tooth that supports the crown or bridge, unto which it is cemented. In the case of a dental bridge, the supporting or abutment teeth are commonly the two adjacent teeth or implants that support the bridge while for a crown, it is the tooth to be crowned.
sections.audioText: It is a tooth that supports the crown or bridge, unto which it is cemented. In the case of a dental bridge, the supporting or abutment teeth are commonly the two adjacent teeth or implants that support the bridge while for a crown, it is the tooth to be crowned.

sections.content: For this treatment, you might need two or more appointments.
sections.audioText: For this treatment, you might need two or more appointments.

sections.section: Initial visit- Record the tooth color,
sections.content: During the initial visit, the dentist will record the tooth colour,
sections.audioText: During the initial visit, the dentist will record the tooth colour,

sections.content: The dentist may then administer local anesthetic in an injection to numb the teeth and surrounding gum.
sections.audioText: The dentist may then administer local anesthetic in an injection to numb the teeth and surrounding gum.

sections.section: Initial visit- Trim the supporting tooth
sections.content: Then, a portion of the crown of an existing natural tooth/or teeth will be trimmed to create space for the crown or bridge using a dental drill,
sections.audioText: Then, a portion of the crown of an existing natural tooth/or teeth will be trimmed to create space for the crown or bridge using a dental drill,

sections.content: and then, take measurements of the trimmed tooth/teeth and surrounding gum for the fabrication of a model. The measurements of the teeth may be made before and after tooth preparation, to help in the design of temporary and final crown or bridge. Measurements may be done using a scan.
sections.audioText: and then, take measurements of the trimmed tooth/teeth and surrounding gum for the fabrication of a model. The measurements of the teeth may be made before and after tooth preparation, to help in the design of temporary and final crown or bridge. Measurements may be done using a scan.

sections.section: Placement of temporary crown or bridge
sections.content: Following the trimming of a tooth, a temporary crown or bridge will be placed to protect the trimmed tooth while you wait for the final crown or bridge.
sections.audioText: Following the trimming of a tooth, a temporary crown or bridge will be placed to protect the trimmed tooth while you wait for the final crown or bridge.

sections.section: Placement of temporary crown or bridge
sections.content: Following the trimming of a tooth, a temporary crown or bridge will be placed to protect the trimmed tooth while you wait for the final crown or bridge.
sections.audioText: Following the trimming of a tooth, a temporary crown or bridge will be placed to protect the trimmed tooth while you wait for the final crown or bridge.

sections.content: At the next visit, when the final crown or bridge is ready, the dentist will remove the temporary crown, try in the final crown or bridge, and then permanently cement it on the trimmed tooth/teeth.
sections.audioText: At the next visit, when the final crown or bridge is ready, the dentist will remove the temporary crown, try in the final crown or bridge, and then permanently cement it on the trimmed tooth/teeth.

sections.content: You should maintain good oral hygiene and have periodic dental check-ups after your crown or bridge is permanently fixed on the trimmed tooth or teeth.
sections.audioText: You should maintain good oral hygiene and have periodic dental check-ups after your crown or bridge is permanently fixed on the trimmed tooth or teeth.

sections.content: The crown or bridge protects the tooth or teeth from breaking.
sections.audioText: The crown or bridge protects the tooth or teeth from breaking.

sections.content: Crowns and bridges may improve oral functions such as smiling, speaking, and smiling, chewing.
sections.audioText: Crowns and bridges may improve oral functions such as smiling, speaking, and smiling, chewing

sections.content: A crown or bridge can remain functional for a long time, but may not last forever.  ( video, continue chewing)
sections.audioText: A crown or bridge can remain functional for a long time, but may not last forever.  ( video, continue chewing)

sections.section: Able to eat a wide variety of foods
sections.content: With the crown or bridge in place, you can eat a wide range of foods except for very hard foods.
sections.audioText: With the crown or bridge in place, you can eat a wide range of foods except for very hard foods.

sections.content: The patient does not have to periodically remove the crown or bridge because it is permanently cemented onto the existing natural tooth or teeth or an implant.
sections.audioText: The patient does not have to periodically remove the crown or bridge because it is permanently cemented onto the existing natural tooth or teeth or an implant.

sections.section: Other benefits of crowns and bridges
sections.content: Depending on the specific dental problem, crowns or bridges can have other benefits, such as improving the shape or color of the natural tooth, and may lead to improvement in self-esteem.
sections.audioText: Depending on the specific dental problem, crowns or bridges can have other benefits, such as improving the shape or color of the natural tooth, and may lead to improvement in self-esteem.

sections.content: Local anesthetic injection may cause pain, anxiety, and temporary numbness of the tongue and face tissues. There may be allergic reactions, swelling, or pain in the jaw muscles.
sections.audioText: Local anesthetic injection may cause pain, anxiety, and temporary numbness of the tongue and face tissues. There may be allergic reactions, swelling, or pain in the jaw muscles.

sections.content: Pain may occur during the procedure or later in the gums surrounding the trimmed teeth for a few days after tooth trimming.
sections.audioText: Pain may occur during the procedure or later in the gums surrounding the trimmed teeth for a few days after tooth trimming.

sections.content: The teeth may exhibit mild to severe sensitivity after tooth preparation, if the crowns are to be made for vital teeth This sensitivity may last only for a short time or may last for much longer periods. If it is persistent, notify the dentist.
sections.audioText: The teeth may exhibit mild to severe sensitivity after tooth preparation, if the crowns are to be made for vital teeth This sensitivity may last only for a short time or may last for much longer periods. If it is persistent, notify the dentist.

sections.content: Immediately after permanent cementation, it is common to feel a little uneasy with the crown or experience some slight changes in your mouth. Usually, this lasts for a short time.
sections.audioText: Immediately after permanent cementation, it is common to feel a little uneasy with the crown or experience some slight changes in your mouth. Usually, this lasts for a short time.

sections.content: If the trimmed teeth are vital, you may experience mild to severe thermal or tactile sensitivity following trimming. This sensitivity could remain for a short time or much longer. If it persists, contact the dentist.
sections.audioText: If the trimmed teeth are vital, you may experience mild to severe thermal or tactile sensitivity following trimming. This sensitivity could remain for a short time or much longer. If it persists, contact the dentist.

sections.section: Risk of having to do root canal treatment for abutment teeth
sections.content: Vital teeth may require root canal treatment before crowning. The need for root canal treatment may also become obvious during tooth preparation or after a crown or bridge is made when the tooth becomes non-vital.
sections.audioText: Vital teeth may require root canal treatment before crowning. The need for root canal treatment may also become obvious during tooth preparation or after a crown or bridge is made when the tooth becomes non-vital.

sections.content: The prepared teeth may develop tooth decay and . the gum may also develop an infection.
sections.audioText: The prepared teeth may develop tooth decay and . the gum may also develop an infection.

sections.section: Uncomfortable or strange feeling in jaw joints
sections.content: You may feel uncomfortable in the jaw joints. This may occur because of the differences between natural teeth and artificial replacements and is usually adjusted by the dentist. This feeling should only be temporary.
sections.audioText: You may feel uncomfortable in the jaw joints. This may occur because of the differences between natural teeth and artificial replacements and is usually adjusted by the dentist. This feeling should only be temporary.

sections.content: The prepared teeth may develop tooth decay in case of leakage or ill-fitting crown or bridge margins.
sections.audioText: The prepared teeth may develop tooth decay in case of leakage or ill-fitting crown or bridge margins.

sections.content: Sometimes the crown or bridge may fail due to leakage, fracture or fall off the supporting the tooth.
sections.audioText: Sometimes the crown or bridge may fail due to leakage, fracture or fall off the supporting the tooth.

sections.section: Re-infection in case of root-canal-filled teeth
sections.content: If your tooth is root-canal-filled, there is always the possibility of re-infection of the tooth roots, regardless of whether you have crowns or bridges. This may demand extra treatment for the root canals of the tooth.
sections.audioText: If your tooth is root-canal-filled, there is always the possibility of re-infection of the tooth roots, regardless of whether you have crowns or bridges. This may demand extra treatment for the root canals of the tooth.

sections.content: There may be several treatment options for the management of your dental problem. Your dentist will tell you the alternative treatment options that apply to your condition. Each alternative treatment has its advantages and limitations. The options may include: • Partial coverage restoration or veneer; • Removal of the tooth and replacement with an implant; • Removal of the tooth and replacement with a removable denture; • No treatment at all.
sections.audioText: There may be several treatment options for the management of your dental problem. Your dentist will tell you the alternative treatment options that apply to your condition. Each alternative treatment has its advantages and limitations. The options may include: • Partial coverage restoration or veneer; • Removal of the tooth and replacement with an implant; • Removal of the tooth and replacement with a removable denture; • No treatment at all.

sections.section: Alternative materials for crowns and bridges
sections.content: Crowns and bridges can be made from a variety of materials, which may be tooth-colored or metallic. These materials have different advantages and disadvantages, which your dentist should inform you of.
sections.audioText: Crowns and bridges can be made from a variety of materials, which may be tooth-colored or metallic. These materials have different advantages and disadvantages, which your dentist should inform you of.

sections.content: A root canal is a dental procedure to remove infected or damaged pulp from inside a tooth. It helps save the tooth and relieve pain.
sections.audioText: A root canal is a dental procedure to remove infected or damaged pulp from inside a tooth. It helps save the tooth and relieve pain.

sections.section: Why you need a Root Canal
sections.content: You may need a root canal due to severe decay, repeated dental procedures, or trauma that causes pulp damage.
sections.audioText: You may need a root canal due to severe decay, repeated dental procedures, or trauma that causes pulp damage.

sections.content: A root canal allows you to keep your natural tooth, which is essential for chewing and maintaining proper alignment of your other teeth.
sections.audioText: A root canal allows you to keep your natural tooth, which is essential for chewing and maintaining proper alignment of your other teeth.

sections.content: The procedure removes the infected or damaged pulp, providing relief from the pain and discomfort associated with pulp damage.
sections.audioText: The procedure removes the infected or damaged pulp, providing relief from the pain and discomfort associated with pulp damage.

sections.content: Sometimes, not all infected tissue is removed, which could lead to persistent or recurring infection.
sections.audioText: Sometimes, not all infected tissue is removed, which could lead to persistent or recurring infection.

sections.content: There is a small risk that the procedure could damage neighboring teeth or structures in the mouth.
sections.audioText: There is a small risk that the procedure could damage neighboring teeth or structures in the mouth.
